org.coniks.coniks_server

Class RootNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.coniks.coniks_server.TreeNode
      • org.coniks.coniks_server.InteriorNode
        • org.coniks.coniks_server.RootNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RootNode
extends InteriorNode
    Represents a root node in the binary Merkle prefix tree underlying the CONIKS key directory.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int digitSize
      Specifies the branching factor of the CONIKS Merkle prefix tree.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RootNode(TreeNode l, TreeNode r, int lvl)
      Constructs a root node specified with left and right subtrees l and r, and the level in tree lvl.
      RootNode(TreeNode l, TreeNode r, int lvl, byte[] lh, byte[] rh)
      Constructs a root node specified with left and right subtrees l and r and their corresponding hashes lh and rh, and the level in tree lvl.

    • Field Detail

      • digitSize

        public final int digitSize
        Specifies the branching factor of the CONIKS Merkle prefix tree. CONIKS is currently uses a binary tree.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        setHashes in class InteriorNode

      • clone

        public RootNode clone()
        Clones (i.e. duplicates) this root node. It then recursively calls this function on the original root node's two subtrees.

        This function is called as part of the CONIKS Merkle tree rebuilding process at the beginning of every epoch.

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The cloned root node.
